alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 8:33AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following county, Northampton. Portions of southeast Virginia, including the following counties, Greensville and Sussex. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to develop across northeast North Carolina and southeast Virginia this afternoon through tonight, as developing tropical low pressure moves north off the southeast coast, eventually tracking inland across eastern North Carolina. Rain continues into Saturday night. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible through Saturday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
